text: Ralph Boschung (born 23 September 1997) is a Swiss racing driver who competed in Formula 2 from to , for Campos Racing, MP Motorsport and Trident. ==Career== ===Formula BMW Talent Cup=== In 2012, Boschung competed in open- wheel racing, in Formula BMW Talent Cup. He ended the season 5th. ===ADAC Formel Masters=== In 2013, Boschung competed in ADAC Formel Masters from Team KUG Motorsport and ended the season 7th. In 2014, he moved to Lotus and ended the season 7th. ===GP3 Series=== In 2015, Boschung debuted in the GP3 Series with Jenzer Motorsport, finishing 11th in the championship and finishing on the podium in the sprint race at Silverstone. For the 2016 season, Boschung switched to Koiranen GP. He won the sprint race at the Red Bull Ring and finished 11th in the standings, helping Koiranen to finish 5th in the team championship. ===FIA Formula 2=== In 2017 Boschung signed for Campos Racing to compete in the inaugural FIA Formula 2 Championship. He had various teammates, those being Stefano Coletti, Roberto Merhi, Robert Vișoiu and Álex Palou. Boschung himself didn't complete the season and was replaced by Lando Norris for the 2017 Yas Marina FIA Formula 2 round. Boschung scored 11 points and finished 19th in the championship. In 2018 he competed for MP Motorsport alongside Merhi. He scored 17 points and finished the season in 18th, however, he again failed to sit out the season, being replaced by Niko Kari for the rounds at Sochi and Abu Dhabi. Boschung raced for Trident in the 2019 FIA Formula 2 Championship, where he scored 3 points and finished 19th in the championship. His season was plagued by funding problems, due to which he lost his seat for the rounds in Austria, Britain, Italy and Abu Dhabi. Trident subsequently finished last in the team championship. ==Racing record== ===Career summary=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 90%; text- align:center" ! Season ! Series ! Team ! Races !
